attributes.action: demand that the Prime Minster states the British government’s commitment to a free and independent Tibet.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In a parliamentary statement to the house on the 29th October the Secretary of State for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs David Miliband MP shamefully legitimised the People’s Republic of China’s occupation of Tibet by stating “we regard Tibet as part of the People’s Republic of China”. This statement in our opinion flies utterly in the face of British public opinion which has for many year consistently been in support of the Tibetan people in their struggle against the oppression and occupation by an aggressive foreign power.

We demand that the Prime Minister makes a statement to the house reversing the decision of his Secretary of State to legitimise China’s occupation of Tibet and states his full support of a free and independent Tibet.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
